meanings.definition: In a surly or ill-tempered manner.
meanings.sent1: He walked grumpily to his room after being scolded.
meanings.sent2: She answered grumpily when asked about her day.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed grumpily when it didn't get its favorite treat.
meanings.sent4: The clouds hung grumpily in the sky, threatening rain.
meanings.sent5: The old man grumpily waved his cane at the noisy children.

meanings.definition: Showing a bad temper or mood.
meanings.sent1: The grumpily cat refused to be petted.
meanings.sent2: She gave a grumpily response to the suggestion.
meanings.sent3: The grumpily toddler threw his toys in frustration.
meanings.sent4: The grumpily sky matched his foul mood perfectly.
meanings.sent5: His grumpily expression scared off the cheerful visitors.
